questions.question_text: Which setting is required to restrict Chrome Remote Desktop use to only accounts on your domain?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Remote access clients
Available on ChromeOS devices.
Configures the required domain name for remote access clients and prevents users from changing the setting. Only clients from the specified domain can connect to the host device. Left blank, the host allows connections from authorized users from any domain.
https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/2657289?hl=en#zippy=%2Cremote-access-clients

choices.E: Use a dedicated ZTE Admin account for device enrollment
choices.C: Generate a ZTE pre-provision enrollment token directly for your domain root OU
choices.D: Generate a ZTE pre-provision enrollment token for your specified user OU
choices.B: Give the company domain name to your Chrome Partner to enable ZTE
choices.A: Generate a ZTE pre-provision enrollment token for your specified device OU

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
Generate a ZTE pre-provision enrollment token for your specified device OU:
This step involves generating an enrollment token for the specific device organizational unit (OU) in the Google Admin Console. This token ensures that the devices, when they first connect to the internet, will automatically enroll into the correct OU based on the token settings.

Give the company domain name to your Chrome Partner to enable ZTE:
In order to use ZTE, your organization must be set up with a Chrome Partner. The Chrome Partner (usually a reseller or OEM) will need your company domain name to associate the devices you purchase with your Google Admin Console and enable the ZTE process

questions.question_text: As a ChromeOS Administrator, you have been asked to enroll all of your devices into a specific device OU using Zero-Touch Enrollment (ZTE). What are the next steps? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
I remember reading something that points to D.

questions.question_text: An organization decides to move to ChromeOS. The organization spans three continents and 30 countries. Each are may have different policy settings depending on local laws.

choices.D: Set all policies at the office location level
choices.B: Use Google Groups for root level settings and override with OUs
choices.A: Configure geofencing by location of IP address and assign to groups
choices.C: Design an OU structure from broadest bucket of policy setting to narrowest

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Gut check: B.

questions.question_text:
An organization changes their logo. The admin needs to update the desktop wallpaper of devices.

Which group of settings should the admin navigate to when implementing this change?

choices.A: The license follows the device between domains
choices.B: The license grants advanced security benefits
choices.D: The license extends the AUE of the device
choices.C: The license is valid for the life of the product
choices.E: The license can be transferred to other devices after AUE

questions.question_text: What are two benefits of purchasing a Chromebook with a bundled license? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I remember reading something that points to C.
